themes: lack of awareness among artists about funding programs
eligibility requirements exclude those most in need
impact of high rents and affordability crisis on artists
perceived misuse or lack of transparency in nonprofit funding
exclusion of individual artists in favor of organizations
key_phrases: make sure artist know about them
I've been an artist here for over 50 years and only heard about a couple of them
one has to already have a commercial space. Well many artists simply cannot afford a commercial space
she has to share a home to keep a roof over her head and all her art supplies and paintings are in storage
Austin is missing their artists in part for this reason
lots of money is going to nefarious non-profit groups that are not transparent and are taking advantage of this system of grants
Let's fund some of the little people!!
barriers_identified: lack of awareness of funding programs among artists
eligibility requirements that require a commercial space
inability to afford commercial or studio space due to high rents
funding going to non-transparent or exploitative nonprofit groups
solutions_proposed: increase outreach and awareness so artists know about funding programs
change eligibility requirements to include artists without commercial space
direct funding to individual artists and 'the little people' instead of only organizations
